newsitem.title: USA: Interleaf sees further cost reductions.
newsitem.headline: Interleaf sees further cost reductions.

text.p: Interleaf Inc said Monday it expects further reductions in costs and expenses.

Reporting a third quarter, ended December 31, loss of $9.5 million, the company said it included $6.0 million in one-time charges, such as $3.7 million for a restructuring to reduce expenses, and $2.3 million for the write-down of intangible assets in connection with the sale of The Learning Alliance, an Interleaf subsidiary.
Chief Financial Officer, Robert Langer, noted: "Ongoing operating costs and expenses for the quarter totalled $18.7 million, a decrease of $3.3 million from the previous quarter.

"Based on anticipated additional savings from recent restructurings and our plans to continue to tightly control all expenditures, we expect additional reductions in costs and expenses going forward," he said.

"We still need to increase revenues and have made this the primary goal of Jaime Ellertson, who commences his new role as Interleaf president and CEO today," interim chief executive Rory Cowan said. ((-- New York Newsdesk 212-859-1610.))
